wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the VnV24 e-commerce platform. Explain its purpose as a full-stack fragrance and essential oils marketplace with integrated authentication, product catalog, shopping cart, wishlist, order management, and blog functionality. Document the architectural separation between the Next.js frontend and Express.js backend, highlighting the App Router structure and RESTful API design. Include high-level diagrams showing system context and component interaction. Explain the technology choices and their impact on developer experience and scalability. Provide a conceptual walkthrough of user journeys from browsing products to checkout completion. Address the role-based access control system differentiating customer and admin experiences. Document deployment considerations and production readiness features.

wiki_catalogs.name: Layout System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Next.js layout system in the VnV24 application. Explain the implementation of the root layout in layout.js and how it provides shared UI structure across all pages. Detail the integration and behavior of Header and Footer components within the layout hierarchy. Describe how nested layouts could be implemented for feature-specific UI consistency. Document the use of React Server Components in the layout and their impact on performance and SEO. Include examples of how page content is composed within the layout using the default slot pattern. Address responsive design considerations in the layout and navigation elements. Explain hydration patterns and client-side interactivity in header elements such as cart indicators or authentication status.

wiki_catalogs.name: Server Initialization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Express.js server initialization process. Explain the sequence of operations during startup, including environment variable loading via dotenv, database connection establishment using connectDB, and Express app configuration. Detail the middleware setup including express.json() for JSON parsing, cookie-parser for cookie handling, and CORS configuration with origin whitelisting and credential support. Document the role of each imported route module and how they are mounted under versioned API paths. Include error handling during startup and port binding logic. Provide a diagram showing the startup flow from entry point to active listener. Highlight configuration dependencies and failure points with troubleshooting guidance for common startup issues such as database connectivity problems or port conflicts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend Directory Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content explaining the frontend directory structure of the VnV24 repository located in /client. Detail the Next.js App Router organization under /client/app, including static pages (about, contact, privacy-policy), dynamic routes ([slug] for blog posts and [productId] for product details), and the root layout and page structure. Explain the components directory organization by feature (Home, Shop, shared) and reusable UI elements like Header and Footer. Document the role of configuration files such as next.config.mjs, tailwind.config.js, and jsconfig.json in the build and styling process. Include an overview of the .next directory as a build output folder containing server-side rendered chunks, asset manifests, and runtime modules. Provide practical navigation guidance for developers to locate routing logic, UI components, and global styles. Address how page.js files map to routes and how layout.js enables shared UI across pages. Highlight the use of utility-first CSS with Tailwind and animation integration via Framer Motion.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the User model in the VnV24 application. Detail all fields including name, email, password (hashed), role (customer/admin), addresses (array of shipping/billing), wishlist (reference array), and authentication metadata (createdAt, updatedAt). Explain schema-level validations such as email format, password complexity, and unique constraints. Document the pre-save hook for password hashing using bcryptjs. Describe the relationship between User and other models: one-to-many with Order and Wishlist. Include indexing strategy on email and role fields for query optimization. Provide a sample document showing a registered user with multiple addresses and role-based access. Explain how JWT tokens are generated based on user identity and role, and how this impacts authorization flows. Address security considerations including password encryption, role privilege escalation prevention, and session management implications.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the Authentication API endpoints in the VnV24 application. Document all HTTP methods (POST for login, register, refresh token, logout) with their respective URL patterns, request body schemas (email, password, name), and response formats (JWT tokens, user data). Specify authentication requirements for protected routes using JWT in Authorization header. Detail the role-based access control implementation for admin and customer roles. Include error responses with status codes (400, 401, 403, 409) and message formats. Provide curl examples and JavaScript fetch examples for user registration and login flows. Explain the token refresh mechanism and security considerations including password hashing with bcryptjs. Include sequence diagrams showing the complete authentication flow from registration to protected resource access.

wiki_catalogs.name: ProductCard Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the ProductCard UI component used throughout the VnV24 e-commerce platform. Document all props including product data structure, image handling, pricing display, and action callbacks. Explain the implementation of hover effects and animations using Framer Motion, including transition timing and visual feedback. Detail the responsive design behavior across mobile, tablet, and desktop breakpoints using Tailwind CSS. Describe accessibility features such as ARIA labels, focus management, and screen reader support. Provide usage examples showing integration with product data from the backend API, including loading states and error handling. Document customization options for styling and behavior, including theme compatibility and event handling for add-to-cart and wishlist actions. Address performance considerations such as image optimization, lazy loading, and rendering efficiency in product grids.

wiki_catalogs.name: Home Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Home module components. Explain the purpose and integration of Hero, FeaturedProducts, CategoryLinks, and PromotionalBanners in creating an engaging landing experience. Document how FeaturedProducts consumes ProductCard to display curated items with animations powered by Framer Motion. Include code examples showing data flow from page to component, responsive layout techniques using Tailwind CSS, and accessibility considerations. Describe the visual hierarchy, animation triggers on scroll, and interaction states. Address performance optimizations such as image loading strategies and component lazy-loading where applicable.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Module
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the authentication module implementation. Thoroughly explain the interaction between Auth.routes.js, Auth.controller.js, and User.model.js in handling user registration, login, and JWT token management. Document the middleware flow using Auth.middleware.js for route protection and role-based access control. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing request validation, password hashing with bcryptjs, and token generation/verification. Explain how the module integrates with the frontend via API calls and manages session state. Address common issues such as token expiration, refresh mechanisms, and security best practices. Provide usage examples for protected routes and demonstrate error handling for invalid credentials or unauthorized access.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Module
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the authentication module in the VnV24 backend. Explain the implementation of user registration, login, logout, and token refresh flows in Auth.controller.js, including password hashing with bcryptjs and JWT token generation using the token.js utility. Document how Auth.routes.js maps these controller methods to RESTful endpoints under /api/v1/auth. Detail the role of Auth.middleware.js in verifying JWT tokens and enforcing role-based access control (e.g., admin vs customer). Describe the User model schema fields relevant to authentication (email, password, role, tokens). Include code examples showing request/response payloads, error handling for invalid credentials, and secure token storage practices. Address common issues such as expired token handling, password reset workflows, and protection against brute-force attacks. Provide guidance on extending authentication with social login or two-factor authentication.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content detailing the full technology stack of the VnV24 application. Break down frontend technologies including Next.js 15 with React 19, App Router architecture, Server Components, and React Server Components. Document styling solutions with Tailwind CSS, PostCSS, and utility-first methodology. Cover animation libraries (Framer Motion) and icon implementation (Lucide React). For the backend, detail Express.js configuration, MongoDB with Mongoose ODM, JWT authentication, and middleware patterns. Include third-party integrations: Stripe and Razorpay for payments, Cloudinary for media storage, and Nodemailer for email services. Explain the rationale behind each technology choice and version compatibility. Document development tools including ESLint, Turbopack, and configuration files (next.config.mjs, tailwind.config.js). Provide guidance on version management and dependency updates.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the component-based architecture of the frontend. Explain the feature-based organization of components into Home, Shop, and shared directories. Thoroughly document the ProductCard component as a reusable UI element, including its props interface, visual states, and interaction patterns (hover effects, animations). Describe how ProductCard is consumed by ProductGrid in the Shop module and FeaturedProducts in the Home module. Include code examples showing component composition and data flow from parent to child. Address accessibility features, responsive behavior, and image optimization within these components. Explain the use of Framer Motion for animations and Lucide React for icons within this component ecosystem.

wiki_catalogs.name: MVC Architecture Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the MVC pattern implementation in the backend. Describe the separation of concerns between routes (handling HTTP requests), controllers (implementing business logic), and models (managing data and database interactions). Use the authentication module as a primary example to illustrate the flow from route definition to controller action to model operation. Document naming conventions, file organization, and import patterns that maintain clean boundaries between layers. Explain how request validation is handled across layers and how errors propagate from model to controller to response. Include sequence diagrams for key operations like user registration and login. Address how the pattern supports maintainability, testability, and scalability of the codebase.

wiki_catalogs.name: Backend Directory Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the backend directory structure of the VnV24 repository located in /server. Explain the MVC architecture implementation with clear separation between routes (defining API endpoints), controllers (handling business logic), models (defining MongoDB schemas via Mongoose), and middleware (enforcing authentication and authorization). Detail the role of /server/src/config/db.js in establishing the database connection and /server/src/utils/token.js in JWT token generation and verification. Document how Express.js server.js initializes the application, applies middleware (CORS, body parsing, authentication), and mounts route handlers. Cover the purpose of each model (User, Product, Order, Wishlist) and their relationships. Explain how Auth.middleware.js protects routes using JWT validation and role-based access control. Include examples from Auth.controller.js showing user registration, login, and token refresh flows. Provide guidance on extending the API with new routes and controllers while maintaining architectural consistency.

wiki_catalogs.name: Product Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the Product model used in the VnV24 e-commerce platform. Define each field including name, description, price, category, stock quantity, images (Cloudinary URLs), ratings, and featured status. Document data types, default values (e.g., stock=0, featured=false), and validation rules (e.g., price > 0, required name/description). Explain the schema's support for fragrance-specific attributes such as scent notes, volume, and product type (essential oil, perfume, diffuser). Describe indexing on name, category, and price for efficient filtering and search operations. Include a sample product document for a premium essential oil with multiple images and customer reviews. Discuss how the Product model integrates with the frontend Shop and Product Detail pages, and how image URLs from Cloudinary are rendered. Address performance considerations for large product catalogs, including pagination strategies and caching recommendations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Product API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the Product API endpoints in the VnV24 application. Document all CRUD operations with their HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE), URL patterns, request parameters (pagination, filtering by category), request body schemas (product name, description, price, images, stock), and response formats. Include authentication and authorization requirements using JWT tokens and admin role verification for write operations. Document query parameters for product filtering, sorting, and pagination. Detail error responses with appropriate status codes (400, 401, 403, 404) and message formats. Provide curl examples and JavaScript fetch examples for retrieving product listings and creating new products. Explain data validation rules for product fields and image upload handling via Cloudinary. Include sequence diagrams for product creation and retrieval flows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Hero Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the Hero component that serves as the primary landing banner on the VnV24 homepage. Detail the component's structure including background imagery, overlay text, call-to-action buttons, and promotional messaging. Explain the implementation of responsive layout behavior across device sizes using Tailwind CSS. Document animation sequences powered by Framer Motion, including entrance effects, text reveal animations, and interactive hover states. Cover configuration options for dynamic content rendering from CMS or API sources. Provide examples of different Hero variations (seasonal promotions, new arrivals, featured collections). Describe accessibility implementation including contrast ratios, keyboard navigation, and ARIA landmark roles. Address performance optimization techniques such as background image loading strategies, video fallbacks, and render prioritization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Shop Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Shop module components. Thoroughly document ProductGrid as the central component for rendering product listings using ProductCard, including virtualization or infinite scroll patterns if present. Explain FilterSidebar's state management and filtering logic integration with the product catalog. Describe SortDropdown's interaction with ProductGrid for dynamic sorting. Include code examples demonstrating component composition, event handling, and state synchronization between filter, sort, and grid components. Address responsive design patterns, accessibility features, and performance considerations for large product sets. Highlight integration with backend APIs for real-time filtering and sorting.

wiki_catalogs.name: Product Management Module
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the product management module. Explain the implementation of CRUD operations through Product.routes.js and their corresponding controller actions in Product.controller.js. Detail the Product.model.js schema including fields like name, description, price, category, stock, and image URLs stored via Cloudinary. Document how filtering, sorting, and searching are implemented in API endpoints. Include examples of request/response payloads for retrieving product lists and individual product details. Explain integration with the frontend shop pages and how product data is structured for display. Address validation rules, error handling for out-of-stock items, and performance considerations for product catalog queries. Provide guidance on extending the model for additional product attributes or variants.

wiki_catalogs.name: Product Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the product management system in the VnV24 backend. Explain the CRUD operations implemented in Product.controller.js for creating, reading, updating, and deleting products, including validation logic and image handling via Cloudinary integration. Document how Product.routes.js exposes these operations through RESTful endpoints under /api/v1/products, supporting filtering, sorting, and pagination. Detail the Product model schema including fields like name, description, price, category, stock, and image URLs. Include examples of API requests for adding a new product or updating inventory. Address business rules such as preventing deletion of products in existing orders, enforcing category constraints, and managing product visibility. Provide guidance on extending the system with product variants, bulk import/export, or search functionality using Elasticsearch.

wiki_catalogs.name: Directory Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content explaining the complete directory structure of the VnV24 repository. Detail the separation between client and server applications, with Next.js frontend in /client and Express.js backend in /server. For the frontend, explain the App Router structure under /client/app, including page routing, dynamic routes ([slug], [productId]), and layout system. Document component organization by feature (Home, Shop, shared) and UI patterns. For the backend, explain the MVC pattern implementation with controllers, models, routes, middleware, and utils directories. Cover configuration files in both applications and their roles in the build and runtime processes. Include explanations of build artifacts in .next directory and their purpose in production deployment. Provide navigation guidance for developers to locate key functionality.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for client-side state management in the VnV24 frontend. Explain how state is managed for cart functionality, including adding/removing items and quantity adjustments. Document the state interaction between ProductCard components and the global cart state, including UI updates and persistence considerations. Describe any context providers or state management patterns used for wishlist functionality. Cover the integration between client-side state and API calls for syncing with backend services. Include examples of state management during navigation between shop, product detail, and cart pages. Address common issues such as state loss during refresh and solutions like localStorage persistence. Discuss performance implications of state updates across large product grids.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the security architecture of the backend system. Detail the JWT-based authentication mechanism including token generation, signing, expiration, and refresh strategies implemented in the token utility. Explain the role of Auth.middleware.js in protecting routes, verifying tokens, and attaching user context to requests. Document the password hashing strategy using bcryptjs and secure cookie practices with HTTP-only flags and secure attributes. Cover role-based access control implementation that differentiates between customer and admin privileges. Include threat modeling considerations such as protection against XSS, CSRF, and brute force attacks. Provide guidance on secure environment variable management and sensitive data exposure prevention in error responses.

wiki_catalogs.name: Build Artifacts and Output Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content explaining the build artifacts generated in the /client/.next directory during Next.js compilation. Detail the purpose of server-side output in /client/.next/server including app routing manifests (app-paths-manifest.json), build metadata (build-manifest.json), server reference tracking (server-reference-manifest.json), and prerendered page assets. Explain how static chunks under /client/.next/static/chunks contain optimized JavaScript bundles for client-side execution, including framework runtime, component code, and third-party libraries. Describe the role of routes-manifest.json in defining dynamic and static routes for server rendering and static generation. Clarify how these artifacts enable features like Server-Side Rendering (SSR), Static Site Generation (SSG), and Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR). Provide insights into how developers can analyze bundle sizes, optimize loading performance, and troubleshoot deployment issues by inspecting these generated files. Highlight the difference between development and production builds where applicable.

wiki_catalogs.name: Order Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Order model in the VnV24 application. Detail all fields including user reference, order items (product, quantity, price at time of purchase), shipping and billing addresses, payment method (Stripe/Razorpay), transaction ID, total amount, and order status (pending, confirmed, shipped, delivered, cancelled). Explain embedded document structure for order items to preserve historical pricing and product data. Document status transition rules and business logic enforced in the Order.controller.js. Describe indexing on user, status, and createdAt for efficient order history queries and admin filtering. Provide a sample order document showing a completed purchase with multiple items and payment confirmation. Explain how inventory is decremented upon order confirmation and restored on cancellation. Address data integrity concerns such as preventing duplicate orders, handling partial failures, and ensuring atomic updates during order processing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Order API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the Order API endpoints in the VnV24 application. Document all HTTP methods (GET for order history, POST for order creation, PUT for order updates) with their URL patterns, request parameters (order ID), request body schemas (order items, shipping address, payment method), and response formats. Specify authentication requirements using JWT tokens and role-based access control (customers can view their orders, admins can view all orders). Detail the order creation flow including inventory validation and stock deduction. Document error responses with status codes (400, 401, 403, 404, 409) and message formats. Provide curl examples and JavaScript fetch examples for placing an order and retrieving order history. Explain data validation rules for order data and integration with payment processing systems. Include sequence diagrams for the complete order placement and order status update flows.

wiki_catalogs.name: ProductGrid Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the ProductGrid component responsible for rendering product listings across the shop and category pages. Document the component's props including product array input, loading states, error handling, and callback functions. Explain the responsive grid layout implementation using Tailwind CSS with dynamic column counts based on screen size. Detail integration with infinite scrolling or pagination patterns and their state management. Describe performance optimizations such as virtualized rendering, lazy loading of images, and memoization techniques. Provide usage examples showing different filtering and sorting states. Cover accessibility features including proper semantic HTML structure, keyboard navigation between products, and screen reader announcements for dynamic content updates. Explain the component's interaction with FilterSidebar and SortDropdown components for coordinated state management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Shared Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the ProductCard component as the primary shared UI element. Detail its props interface (product, scrollYProgress), visual states (hover, active), and animation behavior using Framer Motion. Explain how the y-transform animation enhances user experience during scroll interactions. Document the responsive image handling, price formatting with Intl.NumberFormat, and accessibility attributes. Provide usage examples in different contexts (Home, Shop). Include guidelines for customization, theming via Tailwind classes, and integration with cart/wishlist functionality. Address performance implications of motion values and image optimization strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Order Processing Module
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the order processing module. Explain the complete flow from cart submission to order creation, including how Order.controller.js handles inventory checks, calculates totals, and persists order data through Order.model.js. Document the order schema structure with references to user, order items, shipping/billing addresses, payment method, and status tracking. Detail API endpoints for creating orders, retrieving order history, and updating order status (especially for admin users). Include examples of request payloads from the checkout page and response handling. Explain integration with payment gateways (Stripe, Razorpay) and how order confirmation emails could be extended via Nodemailer. Address error cases like insufficient stock, failed payments, and idempotency in order creation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Order Processing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the order processing module in the VnV24 backend. Explain the implementation of order creation, retrieval, and status updates in Order.controller.js, including transaction handling and inventory deduction logic. Document how Order.routes.js exposes endpoints under /api/v1/orders for users to view their order history and for admins to manage all orders. Detail the Order model schema with references to User and Product models, tracking fields like shipping address, payment method, and order status (e.g., pending, shipped, delivered). Include examples of order creation flow from cart checkout, webhook handling from Stripe/Razorpay, and admin order updates. Address error scenarios such as payment failure, out-of-stock items, and refund processing. Provide guidance on integrating with shipping carriers or generating invoices.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Next.js frontend application. Describe the App Router architecture with server components, client components, and their interaction patterns. Document the layout system with root layout and nested layouts, explaining how shared UI elements are maintained across routes. Detail the component-based architecture with feature-based organization (Home, Shop, shared components). Explain state management patterns across the application, including client-side state for cart and wishlist functionality. Cover data fetching strategies using server-side rendering and API calls. Document the integration between UI components and backend services. Include performance optimization techniques such as code splitting, image optimization, and caching strategies. Address accessibility considerations and responsive design implementation across device sizes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Fetching Strategies
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for data fetching patterns in the Next.js App Router. Explain the implementation of server-side rendering in page components to fetch product and blog data before rendering. Document the use of async/await in server components to call backend APIs. Describe the data flow from API responses to component props and UI rendering. Include examples from shop/page.js for product listings and shop/[productId]/page.js for product details. Address error handling and loading states in data fetching. Explain caching strategies and revalidation patterns for dynamic content. Discuss the security implications of exposing API endpoints through server components and any implemented protection measures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Error Handling and Logging
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the error handling and logging mechanisms in the Express.js backend. Explain the centralized error handling approach, including try-catch patterns in async controllers and global error middleware. Document the structure of error responses with consistent formatting for status codes, messages, and error codes. Describe logging practices for different environments, including success and failure logs for critical operations like authentication and payments. Cover how errors are sanitized before being sent to clients to prevent information leakage. Include examples of error handling in CRUD operations and middleware chain interruptions. Provide best practices for monitoring and debugging production issues using log data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Root-Level Configuration Files
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the root-level configuration files in the VnV24 repository. Explain the role of package.json in both /client and /server directories for managing dependencies, scripts, and project metadata. Document how eslint.config.mjs enforces code quality and style consistency across the frontend. Describe the function of postcss.config.mjs in enabling Tailwind CSS processing and CSS transformation pipeline. Cover the purpose of STYLE_GUIDE_IMPLEMENTATION_SUMMARY.md in documenting design system adherence and UI standards. Explain how README.md serves as the primary entry point for developers with setup instructions, project overview, and contribution guidelines. Include practical examples of running development servers, building the application, and executing linting/formatting tasks using npm scripts. Address environment variable management and cross-project coordination between frontend and backend configurations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Wishlist Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the Wishlist model in the VnV24 application. Explain the one-to-one relationship between User and Wishlist, with the Wishlist containing an array of references to Product documents. Detail schema fields including user (required reference), products (array of Product IDs), and timestamps (createdAt, updatedAt). Describe how the model enables persistent storage of user-favorite items across sessions. Document query patterns such as checking if a product is in a user's wishlist and populating full product details on retrieval. Provide a sample wishlist document showing multiple fragrance products saved by a user. Explain integration with the frontend UI, including the 'Add to Wishlist' button behavior in ProductCard.js and wishlist persistence after login. Address performance considerations for large wishlists, including pagination and client-side caching strategies. Discuss edge cases such as handling deleted products in wishlists and synchronization across devices.

wiki_catalogs.name: Wishlist API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the Wishlist API endpoints in the VnV24 application. Document all HTTP methods (GET for retrieving wishlist, POST for adding items, DELETE for removing items) with their URL patterns, request parameters (product ID), and response formats. Include authentication requirements using JWT tokens as wishlist functionality is user-specific. Detail the data structure of the wishlist response including product references and associated product data. Document error responses with appropriate status codes (400, 401, 404) and message formats. Provide curl examples and JavaScript fetch examples for adding a product to wishlist and retrieving the user's wishlist. Explain the data validation process for product ID and the handling of duplicate entries. Include sequence diagrams for adding and removing products from the wishlist.

wiki_catalogs.name: FilterSidebar Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the FilterSidebar component that enables product filtering in the shop interface. Document all props including filter categories, active filters, callback handlers, and product count displays. Explain the implementation of collapsible filter sections with animated transitions using Framer Motion. Detail the state synchronization between FilterSidebar and ProductGrid components. Cover responsive behavior including mobile drawer implementation versus desktop sidebar layout. Provide examples of different filter types (price range, category, scent profile, brand) and their UI representations. Describe accessibility features such as keyboard navigation, ARIA-expanded states, and screen reader announcements for filter changes. Address performance considerations for real-time filtering, debounce strategies for input fields, and efficient state updates during user interactions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Layout Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the global layout components: Header and Footer. Document their role in site navigation, branding, and consistent user experience across pages. Explain Header's functionality including navigation links, search bar, cart indicator, and authentication state display. Describe Footer's structure with links, contact information, and policy references. Include implementation details on responsive behavior (mobile menu), accessibility features (keyboard navigation, ARIA labels), and integration with Next.js routing. Provide examples of component composition within RootLayout and discuss performance considerations like code splitting and hydration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Wishlist Module
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the wishlist module. Explain how Wishlist.routes.js defines endpoints for adding/removing products from a user's wishlist and how Wishlist.controller.js implements the business logic. Detail the Wishlist.model.js schema design with user-product relationships and any additional metadata. Document the API contract including authentication requirements, request/response formats, and error conditions (e.g., duplicate entries). Include examples of frontend integration showing how the wishlist state is synchronized between client and server. Explain how the module supports persistent storage across sessions and integrates with the Product.model.js for validation. Address performance considerations for wishlist operations and potential caching strategies for frequently accessed wishlists.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the user management system in the VnV24 backend. Explain the implementation of user profile management, address book operations, and account settings in User.controller.js. Document how User.routes.js provides endpoints under /api/v1/users for authenticated users to retrieve and update their information. Detail the User model schema including personal details, saved addresses, and role-based permissions. Include examples of API requests for updating user preferences or managing shipping addresses. Address security considerations such as protecting sensitive data, validating input changes, and preventing privilege escalation. Provide guidance on extending user profiles with additional metadata, implementing account deletion with data retention policies, or integrating with third-party identity providers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Backend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Express.js backend application. Describe the MVC pattern implementation with clear separation between routes, controllers, and models. Document the server initialization process, middleware stack configuration, and error handling mechanisms. Explain the database connection strategy with MongoDB and connection pooling considerations. Detail the RESTful API design principles followed throughout the application, including consistent URL patterns, HTTP method usage, and response formats. Cover the security architecture including CORS configuration, input validation, and error sanitization. Explain the logging strategy and monitoring considerations for production deployment. Document the environment configuration system and its impact on different deployment stages.

wiki_catalogs.name: Performance Optimization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for frontend performance optimization techniques in the VnV24 application. Document the configuration in next.config.mjs that enables features like image optimization, code splitting, and bundle analysis. Explain how Tailwind CSS is configured for tree-shaking and minimal bundle size. Describe component-level optimizations such as memoization in ProductCard to prevent unnecessary re-renders in product grids. Cover image optimization strategies including responsive images, lazy loading, and Cloudinary integration. Address the impact of Framer Motion animations on performance and any implemented optimization techniques. Include build-time optimizations and their effect on loading performance. Provide guidance on monitoring and measuring frontend performance metrics.

wiki_catalogs.name: User API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the User API endpoints in the VnV24 application. Document HTTP methods for user profile management (GET for profile retrieval, PUT for profile updates) with their URL patterns, request parameters, request body schemas (name, email, addresses), and response formats. Specify authentication requirements using JWT tokens and authorization rules for accessing user data. Detail the data structure of user responses including personal information, addresses, and role information. Document error responses with status codes (400, 401, 403, 404) and message formats. Provide curl examples and JavaScript fetch examples for updating user profile information. Explain data validation rules for user fields and security considerations for handling sensitive user data. Include sequence diagrams for user profile retrieval and update operations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Shared UI Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create documentation for the remaining shared UI components in the VnV24 application. Cover the Header and Footer components including navigation structure, responsive hamburger menu implementation, and site-wide links. Document the SortDropdown component with its options, state management, and integration with product listing pages. Explain the FeaturedProducts, CategoryLinks, and PromotionalBanners components used on the homepage for content curation. For each component, detail props, events, styling customization through Tailwind CSS, and accessibility implementation. Provide usage examples and describe integration patterns with Next.js App Router and data fetching mechanisms. Address cross-component consistency in design language and interaction patterns across the application.

wiki_catalogs.name: Wishlist Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the wishlist functionality in the VnV24 backend. Explain the implementation of adding, removing, and retrieving wishlist items in Wishlist.controller.js, including duplicate prevention and product availability checks. Document how Wishlist.routes.js exposes endpoints under /api/v1/wishlist for managing user wishlists. Detail the Wishlist model schema with user-product relationships and creation timestamps. Include examples of API requests for syncing wishlist across devices and handling concurrent modifications. Address performance considerations for large wishlists, caching strategies, and synchronization with the shopping cart. Provide guidance on extending wishlists with sharing capabilities, price drop notifications, or integration with recommendation engines.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for all RESTful endpoints in the VnV24 application. Document each API group (Auth, Product, Order, Wishlist, User) with complete details on HTTP methods, URL patterns, request parameters, request body schemas, and response formats. Include authentication requirements for each endpoint, specifying JWT token usage and role-based access control. Document error responses with status codes and message formats. Provide curl examples and JavaScript fetch examples for common operations. Explain rate limiting considerations and API versioning strategy. Cover data validation rules and sanitization processes applied to incoming requests. Include sequence diagrams showing typical API call flows for critical operations like user registration, product listing, and order placement.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Models
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for all MongoDB collections in the VnV24 application. Detail each model (User, Product, Order, Wishlist) with field definitions, data types, validation rules, and default values. Explain entity relationships including references between models (user to orders, product to wishlist). Document indexing strategies and their impact on query performance. Include database schema diagrams showing collections and their relationships. Provide sample documents for each model type. Explain data lifecycle management, including creation timestamps, update tracking, and soft delete patterns. Cover data integrity constraints and business rules enforced at the model level. Document population strategies used in queries and their performance implications.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the JWT-based authentication system in VnV24. Explain the complete authentication flow from user registration through token issuance and protected route access. Document the password hashing strategy using bcryptjs and security considerations. Detail the JWT token structure, including payload contents, signing algorithm, and expiration policies. Explain the refresh token mechanism and rotation strategy for maintaining secure sessions. Cover the middleware implementation that protects routes and verifies user roles. Document the client-side token management including storage in HTTP-only cookies and request header injection. Provide sequence diagrams for login, token refresh, and protected API call flows. Include security best practices and common vulnerability mitigations.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the key UI components in the VnV24 frontend application. Focus on reusable components like ProductCard, Hero, ProductGrid, and FilterSidebar, documenting their props, events, and customization options. Explain the implementation of interactive features including hover effects, animations with Framer Motion, and responsive behavior. Document the integration between components and backend data sources. Provide usage examples with code snippets showing different configuration options. Cover accessibility features including ARIA labels and keyboard navigation support. Explain the styling approach using Tailwind CSS classes and theme customization possibilities. Include performance considerations for component rendering and data loading.

wiki_catalogs.name: Environment Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for environment configuration in the VnV24 application. Document all environment variables required for both frontend and backend operation, including database connection strings, JWT secrets, payment gateway credentials, and Cloudinary configuration. Explain the configuration file structure for Next.js (next.config.mjs), Tailwind CSS (tailwind.config.js), and PostCSS (postcss.config.mjs). Detail the build process configuration and environment-specific settings for development, staging, and production. Cover the process for setting up a new development environment and required dependencies. Document the security considerations for managing sensitive configuration data. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common configuration issues and connection failures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the deployment topology of the VnV24 application. Explain the separation between frontend and backend deployment processes, including Next.js static export and Express.js server deployment. Document the build pipeline for both applications and asset optimization techniques. Cover hosting considerations for static assets and API endpoints. Explain the process for environment variable injection in different deployment platforms. Detail the database deployment strategy and connection management in production. Include scaling considerations for both frontend and backend services. Document monitoring, logging, and error tracking setup for production environments. Provide guidance on deployment to popular platforms like Vercel, AWS, or DigitalOcean.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create a comprehensive getting started guide for developers new to the VnV24 project. Provide step-by-step instructions for cloning the repository, installing dependencies for both client and server applications, and configuring environment variables. Document the process for setting up the MongoDB database and populating initial data. Include commands for starting development servers for both frontend and backend with hot reloading. Provide guidance on accessing the application locally and testing API endpoints. Cover the initial project structure orientation and key files to understand first. Include troubleshooting tips for common setup issues like port conflicts, missing dependencies, and database connection problems. Provide basic usage examples for browsing products, adding items to cart, and navigating the application.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: VnV24 E-commerce Platform

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
The VnV24 project is a full-stack e-commerce platform specializing in fragrances, essential oils, and related products. The application provides a modern shopping experience with a focus on aesthetic presentation and user engagement.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Create an immersive digital storefront for fragrance and essential oil products
- Implement a seamless shopping experience from product discovery to checkout
- Provide an administrative backend for product and order management
- Deliver responsive design across all device types

### Target Audience
- Consumers interested in premium fragrances and essential oils
- Customers seeking natural and artisanal scent products
- Online shoppers looking for a curated, high-quality shopping experience

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
The project follows a monorepo structure with two main components:
- **Client**: Next.js 15 application with React 19 for the frontend
- **Server**: Express.js backend with MongoDB for data persistence

### Design Patterns
The architecture implements a clean separation of concerns with:
- Next.js App Router for server-side rendering and routing
- Component-based UI architecture with React
- RESTful API design for backend services
- MVC pattern in the server implementation

### System Relationships and Data Flow
```mermaid
flowchart TD
  A[Client] --> B[API Layer]
  B --> C[Business Logic]
  C --> D[Data Access]
  D --> E[(Database)]
  A --> F[Static Assets]
  G[User] --> A
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- Client: `client/app/page.js`
- Server: `server/src/server.js`

### Core Modules
- Frontend components: `client/app/components/`
- API controllers: `server/src/controllers/`
- Data models: `server/src/models/`

### Configuration Approach
- Next.js configuration: `client/next.config.mjs`
- Environment configuration: `server/src/config/db.js`
- Styling configuration: `client/tailwind.config.js`

### External Dependencies
- Frontend: `client/package.json`
- Backend: `server/package.json`

### Integration Points
- Authentication: `server/src/controllers/Auth.controller.js`
- Payment processing: Stripe and Razorpay integration
- Image storage: Cloudinary integration

### Component Relationship Diagram
```mermaid
graph LR
  A[Next.js App] --> B[Layout Component]
  A --> C[Page Components]
  B --> D[Header]
  B --> E[Footer]
  C --> F[ProductCard]
  C --> G[FilterSidebar]
  C --> H[SortDropdown]
  I[API] --> J[Controllers]
  J --> K[Models]
  K --> L[MongoDB]
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
The platform offers comprehensive e-commerce functionality including:
- Product catalog with filtering and sorting
- Shopping cart and checkout process
- User authentication and account management
- Content pages (About, Contact, Blog)
- Responsive design for all devices

### Implementation Highlights
- Dynamic product filtering: `client/app/shop/page.js`
- Reusable UI components: `client/app/components/shared/ProductCard.js`
- Layout management: `client/app/layout.js`
- Responsive navigation: `client/app/components/Header.js`

### Feature Architecture Diagram
```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
  [*] --> Home
  Home --> Shop: Browse Collection
  Shop --> ProductDetail: Select Product
  ProductDetail --> Cart: Add to Cart
  Cart --> Checkout: Proceed to Checkout
  Checkout --> Confirmation: Complete Purchase
  Confirmation --> Home: Return to Home
```
Sources:
  - [package.json](client/package.json)
  - [package.json](server/package.json)
  - [next.config.mjs](client/next.config.mjs)
  - [layout.js](client/app/layout.js)
  - [page.js](client/app/page.js)
  - [Hero.js](client/app/components/Home/Hero.js)
  - [ProductCard.js](client/app/components/shared/ProductCard.js)
  - [ProductGrid.js](client/app/components/Shop/ProductGrid.js)
  - [shop/page.js](client/app/shop/page.js)
  - [FilterSidebar.js](client/app/components/Shop/FilterSidebar.js)
  - [SortDropdown.js](client/app/components/Shop/SortDropdown.js)
  - [Header.js](client/app/components/Header.js)
</blog>
